reviewText: I have Victory at Sea (early 1950s) and many things left outof this series is in WW II Battlefront. I loved Victory at Seabut this tops it with more updated material.  I think maybethe Freedom of information act has made it possible to moreinfo you will find in Battlefront.  I think it is a greatbuy for WW II buffs and I recommend it.  I bought mine in theused category and the discs are like new and play good.
summary: An updated version of WW II

reviewerName: God is a refuge for us (Psalms 62:8)
reviewText: I watched Dunkirk and part of Norway on the first DVD. Then I turned it off. The narrator was a bit sensational at times, and boring at other times. The music didn't fit. The footage is not in color; instead, it is black-and-white footage that has been colorized. They jumped from one battle to another without telling the full story of the war.What led up to WWII?  How did WWII start?  What role did Russia play? None of these questions are answered. And why would they start a 5-DVD set with Dunkirk? Is that where the war started? Then they skip to Norway. Why? What about Austria, Czechoslovakia, and Poland? Those countries are only mentioned briefly. It makes no sense. And it gives people a very convoluted impression of the war.This reminds me of the kind of WWII documentaries that some of teachers used to show kids in elementary school or high school...the kind of documentaries where I do not learn about the war at all...instead, I just get glimpses of certain war events with limited explanation. It's the kind of documentary that leaves kids confused about WWII, not wanting to learn more.As of March 2014, most of the reviews for this item are positive. To read some critical reviews, check-out this similar DVD set:World War II - Battlefront 5 Pak. I recommend that you rent it before buying it.There are several WWII documentaries that are much better than this one. Want to know what they are? Then visit my Amazon Collections to see my 4-star and 5-star military/war DVDs, including WWII documentaries:http://www.amazon.com/gp/customers/A12LH2100CKQO/collections
summary: unwatchable when compared to quality WWII documentaries

reviewText: Over the past 2 years I have been re-studying WWII.  I have quite a few DVDs now....This one has to rank in the top 5....it is excellently produced in color and isn't the "same ole, same ole" footage I see in many programs...I'm glad I have this set in my collection...
